title: Puff Bar Has Overtaken Juul as the Favorite E-Cigarette for Teens
sub_head: About 11% of high-school students said they used e-cigarettes; most prefer fruity flavors and disposable devices
body:
Disposable vaporizers are now the most popular type of e-cigarette among middle- and high-school students, overtaking reusable devices like Juul, according to new federal data. And the most commonly used brand—Puff Bar—is one that has remained on the market despite an order by the Food and Drug Administration last year to halt its U.S. sales.
About 11% of U.S. high-school students—an estimated 1.7 million children—said they had used e-cigarettes at least once in the past 30 days. The data are based on a national survey conducted online between Jan. 18 and March 21.
